title: Logan Paul under fire for anti-abortion diss directed at rival KSI
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Logan Paul has come under fire online for an anti-abortion comment he made during a UK press conference with fellow YouTuber, KSI.

The pair were in East London on Monday evening for an insult-slinging match ahead of their fight next month.

Tensions were high as KSI (real name Olajide William ‘JJ’ Olatunji) brought up Logan’s controversial video blog featuring a dead body in a Japanese suicide forest, as well as brought out a dog that looked almost identical to Logan’s recently deceased Pomeranian.

When host of the conference, True Geordie, asked Logan what his rivalry with KSI meant at this point, Logan responded: ‘I might kill this man.’

He added: ‘Y’all may not know it but JJ’s on his fifth abortion. His fifth. That’s five babies dead.

‘And I think I might return the favour. And I might kill you. I might end you. I’mma light you on fire, bro,’ he added.

Logan Paul at East London press conference (Picture: Action Images via Reuters/Tom Jacobs)

KSI did not immediately respond to the abortion comments but the reaction on social media was swift.

Many criticised Logan for trying to shame KSI and his history with abortion.

One social media user wrote: ‘Logan Paul bringing up abortions as a “diss” to KSI. Please don’t use women’s *possibly traumatic* experiences as pawns to further [yo]ur shitty beef for clout.’

Another tweeted: ‘What’s wrong with an abortion? It’s a woman’s body, it’s her choice.’

Then another commentator wrote: ‘Logan Paul making out that abortions are disgusting and shameful and embarrassing makes [me] feel violently sick – there are so many young girls in that audience [and] that is not what should be promoted to them.

‘ABORTIONS ARE A RIGHT AND OUR CHOICE, not yours so don’t get involved,’ they added.

KSI and Logan Paul on stage (Picture: KSI/YouTube)

It’s not the first time Logan has made such an insult.

‘The people don’t care about you anymore. You’re washed up. A has been,’ KSI tweeted in March. ‘You’re the suicide forest boy, and that’s all you’ll ever be. Step aside.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

The American vlogger hit back: ‘Aren’t you on your fifth abortion g? crazy theory but: life is about more than views… sometimes it’s about… ya know… life?’

The rematch is due to take place at the Staples Center in Los Angeles on Saturday 9 November.

The first match ended in a majority draw following six rounds of sparring – in an evening which also saw Logan’s brother Jake Paul go head to head with KSI’s brother Deji.

Logan Paul and KSI have both been approached by metro.co.uk for further comment.
